title: World
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘Undermines free speech’: Labour MP hits back at US government over visa ban on UK campaigners
items.description: Chi Onwurah speaks out after Marco Rubio accused five Europeans, including two Britons, of ‘seeking to suppress American viewpoints they oppose’ A sen...

items.title: Israel strikes southern Lebanon as deadline to disarm Hezbollah nears
items.description: Strikes were latest violation of year-long ceasefire and targeted what Israel said were Hezbollah sites Israel has carried out several airstrikes in s...

items.title: Family pays tribute to daughter, 13, as Greater Manchester police investigate death
items.description: Boy, 14, arrested on suspicion of harassment and later bailed after death of ‘one of a kind’ Madison Richardson A family has paid tribute to their “on...

items.title: Algeria passes law declaring French colonisation a crime
items.description: France’s rule over Algeria from 1830 to 1962 is marked by mass killings and large-scale deportation Algeria’s parliament has unanimously approved a la...

items.title: Republicans aim to exempt major polluters from Pfas cleanup costs
items.description: Water treatment and landfill companies given chance to make case that EPA rules should not apply to them Republicans are attempting to exempt some maj...

items.title: Colorado woman accused of killing her children extradited from UK to US
items.description: Kimberlee Singler is facing murder charges in Colorado in the deaths of her 9-year-old daughter and 7-year-old son.

items.title: UK social media campaigners among five denied US visas
items.description: The Trump administration bans five people who have called for tech regulation from entering the country.

items.title: British boy, 13, fatally stabbed in Portugal
items.description: Tributes have been paid to the boy who has been named by a local basketball club as Alfie Hallett.

items.title: Flu cases falling ahead of Christmas, experts say
items.description: UK health agency says drop is encouraging news, but warns flu could still bounce back in new year.

items.title: It's time for Wright to retire - Van Gerwen
items.description: Three-time world champion Michael van Gerwen says Peter Wright should retire following his defeat in the PDC World Darts Championship.
